questions.text: Healthcare should be free and provided by the government for everyone.
Higher education (colleges and universities) should be free for all students.
The state should guarantee a basic income grant for all citizens, even if it requires higher taxes or debt.
The government should raise taxes on the wealthy to fund social programs.
The government should invest heavily in public housing for low-income families, even if it means cutting other services.
Rural development and agricultural support should receive significantly more government funding and investment.
Workers should have stronger rights to strike and negotiate directly with employers without government interference.
Black Economic Empowerment (BEE) and affirmative action should remain key government priorities.
Expropriation of private land without compensation is justified to achieve land reform.
The Constitution should be reformed to allow for faster transformation and give government more power to redistribute wealth.
South Africa should prioritise trade agreements that protect local industries, even if it means higher consumer prices.
The country should prioritise investment in renewable energy (solar, wind) over expanding coal power.
Strong action against corruption (even if it disrupts current leaders) is more important than political stability.
To reduce crime, the government should focus more on harsher punishment rather than addressing social causes like poverty.
Illegal immigrants should be deported and strict border control enforced to protect local jobs and resources.
